intro: Ainsliaea spicata, commonly known as the spike ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Ainsliaea spicata thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a soft, velvety texture.
